result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon E. Dykas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from cash bond posted

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Random drug/alcohol tests
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon E. Dykas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:58 p.m. Defendant Jon E. Dykas in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Schiek/Nielsen/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees - to be taken from cash bond posted - Balance of cash bond to be refunded to poster.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail credit - 6 days if revoked
Random Drug/Alcohol Testing
AODA Assessment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 4:23 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

8:50 a.m. Defendant Jon E. Dykas in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen.   Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement to resolution. State moves to amend Count 1 to Possession of Cocaine - a violation of 961.41(3g)(c) - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am. Bail continued. Adj. 8:58 a.m.

11:29 a.m. Defendant Jon E. Dykas in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Nielsen withdraws motion; possible resolution. Requests plea hearing. Court removes JT from calendar. Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Jon E. Dykas in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nielson requests jury trial - plans to file pre-trial motions. Motions to be filed within 30 days of today's date. Bail continued. Adj. 1:38 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:43 p.m. Defendant Jon E. Dykas in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State will file information that mirrors complaint. Not guilty plea entered. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.

03:03 pm - Defendant Jon E. Dykas in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
if money cannot be posted then court will allow inpatient treatment at Koinonia

1:41 p.m:  Judge O'Melia on behalf of Judge BloomDefendant Jon E. Dykas in court, in custody via video.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek Counsel.   Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $3500 Cash  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
